metadata.title: CVE-2018-20786 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - low
metadata.description:
libvterm through 0+bzr726, as used in Vim and other products, mishandlescertain out-of-memory conditions, leading to a denial of service(application crash), related to screen.c, state.c, and vterm.c.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-20786` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

vim - 2:8.1.0875-4ubuntu1
vim-athena - 2:8.1.0875-4ubuntu1
vim-common - 2:8.1.0875-4ubuntu1
vim-gtk3 - 2:8.1.0875-4ubuntu1
vim-gui-common - 2:8.1.0875-4ubuntu1
vim-motif - 2:8.1.0875-4ubuntu1
vim-nox - 2:8.1.0875-4ubuntu1
vim-runtime - 2:8.1.0875-4ubuntu1
vim-tiny - 2:8.1.0875-4ubuntu1
xxd - 2:8.1.0875-4ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libvterm package in mantic is affected and needs fixing.
vim package in mantic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2:8.1.0875-4ubuntu1').
